File I/O Utilities¶

FileIO¶

class ml4ir.base.io.file_io.FileIO(logger: Optional[logging.Logger] = None)¶

Bases: object

Abstract class defining the file I/O handler methods

clear_dir(dir_path: str)¶

Clear contents of existing directory

Parameters

dir_path – path to directory to be cleared

get_files_in_directory(indir: str, extension='.csv', prefix='')¶

Get list of files in a directory

Parameters

  • indir – input directory to search for files

  • extension – extension of the files to search for

  • prefix – string file name prefix to narrow search

Returns

list of file path strings

log(string, mode=20)¶

Wrapper method for logging

Parameters

  • string – String to be logged

  • mode – logging mode to use

make_directory(dir_path: str, clear_dir: bool = False) → str¶

Create directory structure specified recursively

Parameters

  • dir_path – path for directory to be create

  • clear_dir – clear contents on existing directory

Returns

directory path

path_exists(path: str) → bool¶

Check if a path exists

Parameters

path – check if path exists

Returns

True if path exists; False otherwise

read_df(infile: str, sep: str = ', ', index_col: int = None) → Optional[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]¶

Load a pandas dataframe from a file

Parameters

  • infile – path to the csv input file

  • sep – separator to use for loading file

  • index_col – column to be used as index

Returns

pandas dataframe

read_df_list(infiles, sep=', ', index_col=None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Load a pandas dataframe from a list of files

Parameters

  • infiles – paths to the csv input files

  • sep – separator to use for loading file

  • index_col – column to be used as index

Returns

pandas dataframe

read_json(infile) → dict¶

Read JSON file and return a python dictionary

Parameters

infile – path to the json file

Returns

python dictionary

Read text file and return as string

Parameters

infile – path to the text file

Returns

file contents as a string

Read YAML file and return a python dictionary

Parameters

infile – path to the json file

Returns

python dictionary

Parameters

dir_path – path to directory to be removed

Deletes existing file_path

Parameters

file_path – path to file to be removed

set_logger(logger: Optional[logging.Logger] = None)¶
write_df(df, outfile: str = None, sep: str = ', ', index: bool = True)¶

Write a pandas dataframe to a file

Parameters

  • df – dataframe to be written

  • outfile – path to the csv output file

  • sep – separator to use for loading file

  • index – boolean specifying if index should be saved

write_json(json_dict: dict, outfile: str)¶

Write dictionary to a JSON file

Parameters

  • json_dict – dictionary to be dumped to json file

  • outfile – path to the output file

LocalIO¶

class ml4ir.base.io.local_io.LocalIO(logger: Optional[logging.Logger] = None)¶

Bases: ml4ir.base.io.file_io.FileIO

Class defining the file I/O handler methods for the local file system

clear_dir_contents(dir_path: str)¶

Clear contents of existing directory

Parameters

dir_path – path to directory to be cleared

get_files_in_directory(indir: str, extension='.csv', prefix='')¶

Get list of files in a directory

Parameters

  • indir – input directory to search for files

  • extension – extension of the files to search for

  • prefix – string file name prefix to narrow search

Returns

list of file path strings

load_numpy_array(file_path, allow_pickle=True, unzip=True, **kwargs)¶

Load a numpy array from disk

Parameters

  • file_path – file path to load the numpy object from

  • allow_pickle – Allow pickling of objects while loading

  • unzip – To unzip the numpy array saved as a zip file. Used when saved with zip=True Returns python list of numpy arrays

Note: Used to load individual model layer weights for transfer learning

make_directory(dir_path: str, clear_dir: bool = False) → str¶

Create directory structure specified recursively

Parameters

  • dir_path – path for directory to be create

  • clear_dir – clear contents on existing directory

Returns

directory path

path_exists(path: str) → bool¶

Check if a path exists

Parameters

path – check if path exists

Returns

True if path exists; False otherwise

read_df(infile: str, sep: str = ', ', index_col: int = None) → Optional[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]¶

Load a pandas dataframe from a file

Parameters

  • infile – path to the csv input file; can be hdfs path

  • sep – separator to use for loading file

  • index_col – column to be used as index

Returns

pandas dataframe

read_df_list(infiles, sep=', ', index_col=None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Load a pandas dataframe from a list of files

Parameters

  • infiles – paths to the csv input files; can be hdfs paths

  • sep – separator to use for loading file

  • index_col – column to be used as index

Returns

pandas dataframe

read_json(infile) → dict¶

Read JSON file and return a python dictionary

Parameters

infile – path to the json file; can be hdfs path

Returns

python dictionary

read_yaml(infile) → dict¶

Read YAML file and return a python dictionary

Parameters

infile – path to the json file; can be hdfs path

Returns

python dictionary

rm_dir(dir_path: str)¶

Delete existing directory

Parameters

dir_path – path to directory to be removed

rm_file(file_path: str)¶

Deletes existing file_path

Parameters

file_path – path to file to be removed

save_numpy_array(np_array, file_path: str, allow_pickle=True, zip=True, **kwargs)¶

Save a numpy array to disk

Parameters

  • np_array – Array like numpy object to be saved

  • file_path – file path to save the object to

  • allow_pickle – Allow pickling of objects while saving

  • zip – use np.savez to save the numpy arrays, allows passing in python list

Note: Used to save individual model layer weights for transfer learning

write_df(df, outfile: str = None, sep: str = ', ', index: bool = True) → str¶

Write a pandas dataframe to a file

Parameters

  • df – dataframe to be written

  • outfile – path to the csv output file; can NOT be hdfs path currently

  • sep – separator to use for loading file

  • index – boolean specifying if index should be saved

Returns

dataframe in csv form if outfile is None

NOTE: Does not support spark write

write_json(json_dict: dict, outfile: str)¶

Write dictionary to a JSON file

Parameters

  • json_dict – dictionary to be dumped to json file

  • outfile – path to the output file

SparkIO¶

class ml4ir.base.io.spark_io.SparkIO(logger: Optional[logging.Logger] = None)¶

Bases: ml4ir.base.io.file_io.FileIO

Abstract class defining the file I/O handler methods

copy_from_hdfs(src: str, dest: str)¶

Copy a directory/file from HDFS to local filesystem

Parameters

  • src (-) – String path to source(on HDFS)

  • dest (-) – String path to destination(on local file system)

copy_to_hdfs(src: str, dest: str, overwrite=True)¶

Copy a directory/file to HDFS from local filesystem

Parameters

  • src (-) – String path to source(on local file system)

  • dest (-) – String path to destination(on HDFS)

  • overwrite (-) – Boolean to specify whether existing destination files should be overwritten

file_path – string file path

Hadoop Path object
